thread.title: Andrew Bogut talking 76ers buyout with eye on Cavs, report says
thread.title_full: Andrew Bogut talking 76ers buyout with eye on Cavs, report says

author: Bob Hille (Bob.Hille@performgroup.com)
title: Andrew Bogut talking 76ers buyout with eye on Cavs, report says
text:
NBA February 27, 2017 8:32am EST February 27, 2017 8:32am EST Basketball, NBA, News, Cleveland Cavaliers, Houston Rockets, Philadelphia 76ers, San Antonio Spurs, English, Andrew Bogut The Rockets and Spurs also are interested in the veteran center, who has to be waived by Wednesday to be playoff-eligible for his next team. Andrew Bogut (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:32 a.m. ET 
Updated at 8:32 a.m. ET 
Andrew Bogut is actively negotiating a buyout with the 76ers, and the Cavaliers have emerged as the favorite to sign the veteran center if he's released, ESPN.com reported , citing unidentified NBA sources. 
If the Cavs are hoping to have Bogut for the playoffs, he must be waived by Wednesday, the last day a player can be released and be eligible for the postseason with his next team. 
MORE: Stephen Curry sneaks out of huddle to help Warriors fan win $5,000 
Bogut, 32, was traded last week from the Mavericks to the 76ers in a deal involving Nerlens Noel, and ESPN cited two unidentified Mavs sources as saying they expect Bogut to choose the Cavs if he can negotiate his release in Philly. Read This
